programme.desc: Paddington's Beach Clean-Up / Paddington's Holiday Farewell - The beach is a mess, but will all the litter be cleared in time for the beach party that everyone has been looking forward to? // The summer holidays have come to an end, so it's time to say goodbye to their new friends.

programme.title: The Adventures of Paddington S3 Ep324
programme.desc: Paddington Has To Say Goodbye - The time has come for Aunt Lucy to go home, but there's still time for one last adventure, or is there?

programme.title: Blaze and the Monster Machines S5 Ep515
programme.desc: Big Rig Blaze - When a windstorm blows away the supplies for Stripes' Animal Party, Blaze transforms into the one Monster Machine strong enough to haul it all back - a Big Rig! There's nothing he can't pull with that Big Rig Force!

programme.title: PAW Patrol S10 Ep1010
programme.desc: Liberty's Mountain Rescue / Pups Save a Flying Farmer Yumi - Liberty comes to visit the pups just in time to help save the Turbots and their radar doppler in a daring mountain rescue. // When Farmer Al builds a windmill, the wind takes Farmer Yumi and Garby on a wild flight.

programme.title: PAW Patrol S10 Ep1011
programme.desc: Pups Stop the Falling Space Junk / Pups Stop the Giant Cuckoo - When Digi & Tal's space vacuum breaks it's up to the pups to save Mayor Humdinger from falling space debris. // Humdinger's Cuckoo Clock goes out of control. Ryder and the Pups must rescue Travis and get control of the Cuckoo to save Humdinger.

programme.title: Rubble & Crew S1 Ep112
programme.desc: The Crew Does A Home Renovation / The Crew Builds A Lighthouse - The pups are starstruck when their favorite TV renovation star, Hank Hammer, comes to see them at work. // Cap'n Turbot is bringing Mayor Greatway a big surprise. But when a thick fog rolls in, the pups have to build a lighthouse fast!

programme.title: Rubble & Crew S1 Ep113
programme.desc: The Crew Builds A Dinosaur Museum / The Crew Builds a Wheelchair Ramp - After uncovering dinosaur bones, the pups decide to build a dinosaur museum! // When Omar the Mail Carrier breaks his foot, it's up to the pups to make sure he can still deliver the mail by building ramps all over town.

programme.title: DORA S1 Ep111
programme.desc: Wonky Wishing Wand / Bip Bip's Big Show - Big Red Chicken's magic goes wonky and not only shrinks himself, but causes wacky things to happen throughout the rainforest. Dora has to fix it! // Bip Bip has a concert with Tico, but he's lost! Dora and Boots have to get him to the show on time.

programme.title: Baby Shark's Big Show! S2 Ep201
programme.desc: Fort Fin-ship / Water Buggin - When Baby and his friends build a clubhouse, Hank has no idea what to put in his personal nook. // When a noisy water bug takes up residence in the Shark's home, the family will do whatever it takes to reclaim the peace and quiet they lost.

programme.title: Sharkdog S2 Ep213
programme.desc: Meteor Madness - The Sharkpack are excited to watch the meteor shower on Foggy Springs's highest mountain, and Sharkdog knows the best way to get there. The only problem? Captain Quigley thinks she does too.

programme.title: Sharkdog S2 Ep214
programme.desc: Pest Friends Forever - Sharkdog has fleas! Sea fleas, that is. Max will do whatever it takes to get rid of them, but that may be tough because Sharkdog is so itchy, he can't sit still!

programme.title: Sharkdog S2 Ep215
programme.desc: Sleeping Like a Baby - Sharkdog must go on a wild search around town to help Mia find her missing binky and get the baby back to sleep.

programme.title: Peppa Pig S6 Ep619
programme.desc: Fruit - It is fruit day at the supermarket, and Miss Rabbit is making fruit smoothies. Everyone is picking their favourite fruits to blend. George gets a special 'dinosaur' juice, to make him big and strong. Roar!

programme.title: Teletubbies S1 Ep111
programme.desc: Mixed Up - Tinky Winky, Dispy, Laa-Laa and Po have their favourite things. The bag, the hat, the scooter and the ball all magically swap places and become mixed up.

programme.title: Yakka Dee S6 Ep10
programme.desc: Clock - Dee encourages a friend to say 'clock', and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. We see lots of clocks - square, round, one with numbers and one that makes a really loud sound!

programme.desc: Doctor Mae-Mae - Plom's favourite toy is broken, so Doctor Mae-Mae promises to fix it. But when Doctor Mae-Mae realises she's taken on too many patients, she doesn't know if she'll be able to fix Plom's toy after all.

programme.title: Messy goes to OKIDO S1 Ep16

programme.desc: Round and Round - Jeanie says going round in circles won't help find a missing key, but Monty isn't so sure.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Newsline In Depth
programme.desc: Introducing a colorful variety of feature stories, including reports on daily life from locations throughout Japan, as well as other parts of Asia and around the world.

programme.title: Hit The Road 5Minutes
programme.desc: Let's see Japan by car! We'll be driving through Hiroshima Prefecture, with our goal being the famed Itsukushima Shrine. Along the way, we'll make a few stops off the beaten path that will amaze you!

programme.title: Today'S Close-Up
programme.desc: Residents of Japan's Noto Peninsula were rebuilding after a huge earthquake when record rain and floods dealt a new blow. NHK visited the region to see how communities are coping with the setback.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: On The Wings 5Min.
programme.desc: Soar over the silvery snow-clad expanses of Northern Japan, where the majestic Japanese Alps rise to greet you.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Through the use of personal alarms and community policing, Sakurai Masayoshi aims to reduce sexual violence in underprivileged areas. So far, he has provided support to 15,000 women in India.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: We meet French illustrator Emilie Bouquet who runs an eco-friendly farm in Okuma, Fukushima, and Brazilian Suellen Taniguchi who supports kids and teens with learning difficulties in Isesaki, Gunma.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Newsline In Depth
programme.desc: Introducing a colorful variety of feature stories, including reports on daily life from locations throughout Japan, as well as other parts of Asia and around the world.

programme.title: National Parks Of Japan:Daisen-Oki
programme.desc: Daisen-Oki National Park comprises the Oki Islands, which boast spectacular geological formations, and a mainland area with shrines and sacred mountains that gave rise to myths and legends.

programme.title: Learn Japanese From The News
programme.desc: An abacus and mental arithmetic contest was held in Okayama Pref. in August. Participants competed to solve problems with speed and accuracy. We review the story and learn expressions related to math.

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: #24 I can't eat raw eggs. / If there's something you can't or don't want to eat, say the name of the item and "wa taberaremasen."

programme.title: Taxi Driving Opened To Foreigners
programme.desc: In response to a serious labor shortage, Japan's taxi industry is hiring more and more foreign drivers. The program introduces the efforts by both the government and taxi companies to facilitate this.

programme.title: Hello! NHK World-Japan
programme.desc: This time we introduce "Special Series of Kii Peninsula in September," in which we show a variey of programs on 3 prefectures in Kii Peninsula: Nara, Wakayama, and Mie.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Newsline In Depth
programme.desc: Introducing a colorful variety of feature stories, including reports on daily life from locations throughout Japan, as well as other parts of Asia and around the world.

programme.title: Propellers: Unwavering Rationality
programme.desc: Okayama / Hara Kenya (graphic designer) Hara visits a Japanese propeller maker with a 30% global market share, to discover the merit of finding an object's perfect shape, without compromise.

programme.title: Seasoning The Seasons
programme.desc: This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Life After School: Stay Or Go?
programme.desc: We met with a group of international students to hear about their experiences and plans in Japan. Do they see a future for themselves here? Or are they planning to go back abroad? Let's find it!

programme.title: The Playfulness Of Plasterers
programme.desc: Ehime / Nagazumi Takashi (musician) Nagazumi visits a town with a great number of trowel reliefs, and observes that the things that truly last are the ones that carry the creator's intention.

programme.title: Japan From Above: Up Close
programme.desc: This program takes you on an aerial journey across 21st century Japan. Enjoy the bird's-eye view of unique landscapes as well as intimate portraits of the people who inhabit the archipelago.

programme.title: Biz Stream
programme.desc: This episode focuses on new strategies being employed to make traditional Japanese crafts more appealing to a broader range of consumers.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: The esports market is worth $1 billion USD a year, and Tokido is a prominent figure in that world, having won multiple global fighting game championships. Hear about his life in gaming.

programme.title: J-Melo
programme.desc: Join May J. for Japanese music! On the show this week: Niihama Leon (a singer who brings his powerful voice to Showa-era pop) and KiSS KiSS (a super-kawaii female idol group who debuted last year).

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Chatroom Japan
programme.desc: In our Fukushima "chatroom," four international residents of the prefecture share their experiences, and their thoughts on the 2011 disaster.

programme.title: Where We Call Home

programme.title: Trails To Oishii Tokyo Mini
programme.desc: Our focus this time is honey. Innovations like urban beekeeping are born of a global bee crisis. Differing flowers and environments offer infinite flavors in this fascinating world of honey.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Through the use of personal alarms and community policing, Sakurai Masayoshi aims to reduce sexual violence in underprivileged areas. So far, he has provided support to 15,000 women in India.

programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life: Edo'S Rush Hour
programme.desc: Edo was a city of waterways. The Yoroi Ferry transported people across the Nihonbashi River, one of its main commercial arteries. For the captain, it was a high-pressure job requiring skill and guts.

programme.title: Learn Japanese From The News
programme.desc: An abacus and mental arithmetic contest was held in Okayama Pref. in August. Participants competed to solve problems with speed and accuracy. We review the story and learn expressions related to math.

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: #24 I can't eat raw eggs. / If there's something you can't or don't want to eat, say the name of the item and "wa taberaremasen."

programme.title: Taxi Driving Opened To Foreigners
programme.desc: In response to a serious labor shortage, Japan's taxi industry is hiring more and more foreign drivers. The program introduces the efforts by both the government and taxi companies to facilitate this.

programme.title: Hello! NHK World-Japan
programme.desc: This time we introduce "Special Series of Kii Peninsula in September," in which we show a variey of programs on 3 prefectures in Kii Peninsula: Nara, Wakayama, and Mie.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Newsline In Depth
programme.desc: Introducing a colorful variety of feature stories, including reports on daily life from locations throughout Japan, as well as other parts of Asia and around the world.

programme.title: Life After School: Stay Or Go?
programme.desc: We met with a group of international students to hear about their experiences and plans in Japan. Do they see a future for themselves here? Or are they planning to go back abroad? Let's find it!

programme.title: The Playfulness Of Plasterers
programme.desc: Ehime / Nagazumi Takashi (musician) Nagazumi visits a town with a great number of trowel reliefs, and observes that the things that truly last are the ones that carry the creator's intention.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: The esports market is worth $1 billion USD a year, and Tokido is a prominent figure in that world, having won multiple global fighting game championships. Hear about his life in gaming.

programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life: Edo'S Rush Hour
programme.desc: Edo was a city of waterways. The Yoroi Ferry transported people across the Nihonbashi River, one of its main commercial arteries. For the captain, it was a high-pressure job requiring skill and guts.

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.desc: An unattended stand in the middle of Tokyo sells fresh vegetables such as tomatoes and eggplants, all at less than a dollar. We find out why the owner started this place and sells produce so cheaply.

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: #33 How long does it take to get in? / To ask how long something takes, say "donokurai" (how long and how much), then a verb like "machimasu" (to wait), and finally add "ka."

programme.title: Core Kyoto Mini
programme.desc: Elegant and practical, braided cords are essential for kimono and other aspects of everyday life.

programme.title: Wild Hokkaido!
programme.desc: An experienced angler, led by a local nature guide, ventures deep into the forest along the upper reaches of the Teshio River, where they try to catch a big one using skillful fly-fishing techniques.

programme.title: Japan Time-Lapse Ainu
programme.desc: The Ainu: indigenous people of northern Japan. Time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke investigates various aspects of their culture and traditions. This time: Ainu Boats.

programme.title: Japan From Above: Up Close
programme.desc: This program takes you on an aerial journey across 21st century Japan. Enjoy the bird's-eye view of unique landscapes as well as intimate portraits of the people who inhabit the archipelago.

programme.title: Chatroom Japan
programme.desc: In our Fukushima "chatroom," four international residents of the prefecture share their experiences, and their thoughts on the 2011 disaster.

programme.title: Medical Frontiers
programme.desc: A drug approved in Japan in 2018 involves just one injection for lumbar disc hernias, helping many patients for whom surgery was the only way to control the pain. We look at how it works.

Get the latest facts and expert opinions about the most essential stories happening around us and draw your own conclusions.
